author: cnbc.com
title: Big 5 reports 4Q loss
text:
EL SEGUNDO, Calif. (AP) _ Big 5 Sporting Goods Corp. (BGFV) on Tuesday reported a fourth-quarter loss of $13 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
The El Segundo, California-based company said it had a loss of 62 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for pretax expenses, came to 10 cents per share.
The sporting goods retailer posted revenue of $242.9 million in the period.
For the year, the company reported profit of $1.1 million, or 5 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $1.01 billion.
Big 5 shares have declined 22 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $5.95, a fall of 57 percent in the last 12 months.
